alert.note: Alert for Central Oregon; Ochoco-John Day Highlands (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 5:27PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Crook and north central Deschutes Counties through 600 PM PDT... At 527 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Powell Butte, or 9 miles southeast of Redmond, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Redmond, Prineville, Alfalfa and Powell Butte. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
